str2: On this account, because, for. From dia and hoti; on the very account that, or inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: (properly: To call (summon) to witness, and then absolutely) To testify, protest, asseverate; To conjure, solemnly charge.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Today, now. Neuter of a presumed compound of the article ho and hemera; on the day; generally, now.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
